intro: Phlegmariurus mildbraedii, commonly known as the mildbraed's clubmoss, is a member of the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen shrub that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. The plant features whorled leaves that are narrow and linear, forming dense clusters around the stem. Its reproductive structures, known as strobila, are cone-like and contain spores. Phlegmariurus mildbraedii is characterized by its slow growth and ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
